history.proof: intros x H. destruct H as [H1 H2]. left. shelve.

exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 3 branches.
Not an inductive goal with 2 constructors.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall x : Z, inversible Z multZ IZ x -> x = IZ \/ x = oppZ IZ

Premises:
multZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => OZ | pos n => multpos x2 n | neg n => multneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
inversible : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> Prop
oppZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n => neg n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
IZ = pos 0 : Z
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
mult_IZ : forall x : Z, multZ x IZ = x
add_IZ_succZ : forall x : Z, addZ x IZ = succZ x
multZ_neutral = conj I (fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj (eq_ind (multZ IZ x) (fun z : Z => z = x) eq_refl (multZ x IZ) (multZ_commutativity IZ x)) eq_refl) : neutral Z IdZ multZ IZ
Z_unitary_commutative_ring = conj Z_ring (conj multZ_commutativity multZ_neutral) : is_unitary_commutative_ring Z IdZ addZ multZ OZ IZ oppZ
succZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => IZ | pos n => pos (S n) | neg 0 => OZ | neg (S m) => neg m end : Z -> Z
mult_mIZ : forall x : Z, multZ x (neg 0) = oppZ x
tech_multZ_negO : forall x : Z, multZ (neg 0) x = oppZ x
mult_oppZ_r : forall x y : Z, multZ x (oppZ y) = oppZ (multZ x y)
mult_oppZ_l : forall x y : Z, multZ (oppZ x) y = oppZ (multZ x y)
abs_eq_or_oppZ : forall x : Z, {absZ x = x} + {absZ x = oppZ x}
mult_OZ : forall x : Z, multZ x OZ = OZ
mult_succZ_r : forall x y : Z, multZ x (succZ y) = addZ (multZ x y) x
inv_com : forall (S : Set) (Mult : S -> S -> S) (I x : S), commutativity S Mult -> (exists y : S, Mult x y = I) -> inversible S Mult I x
mult_predZ_r : forall x y : Z, multZ x (predZ y) = addZ (multZ x y) (oppZ x)
opp_predZ : forall x : Z, oppZ (predZ x) = succZ (oppZ x)
opp_succZ : forall x : Z, oppZ (succZ x) = predZ (oppZ x)
mult_succZ_l : forall x y : Z, multZ (succZ x) y = addZ (multZ x y) y
tech_integ_posZ : forall (n : nat) (x : Z), multZ (pos n) x = OZ -> x = OZ
tech_integ_negZ : forall (n : nat) (x : Z), multZ (neg n) x = OZ -> x = OZ
mult_predZ_l : forall x y : Z, multZ (predZ x) y = addZ (multZ x y) (oppZ y)
add_OZ : forall x : Z, addZ x OZ = x
add_mIZ_predZ : forall x : Z, addZ x (neg 0) = predZ x
succ_predZ : forall x : Z, succZ (predZ x) = x
pred_succZ : forall x : Z, predZ (succZ x) = x
pred_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (predZ y) = predZ (addZ x y)
succ_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (succZ y) = succZ (addZ x y)
ssrfun.etrans : forall (A : Type) (x y z : A), x = y -> y = z -> x = z
succ_addZ_l : forall x y : Z, addZ (succZ x) y = succZ (addZ x y)
pred_addZ_l : forall x y : Z, addZ (predZ x) y = predZ (addZ x y)
multZ_eq4 : forall n : Z, multZ (neg 0) n = oppZ n
ssrfun.esym = eq_sym : forall (A : Type) (x y : A), x = y -> y = x Arguments ssrfun.esym {A}%type_scope {x y}
gcd_unicity_apart_unities : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O I : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_unitary_commutative_ring S A Add Mult O I Opp -> integrity S Mult O -> forall a b d1 d2 : S, is_gcd S A Mult O a b d1 -> is_gcd S A Mult O a b d2 -> exists x : S, inversible S Mult I x /\ A x /\ d2 = Mult d1 x
mult_O : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_ring S A Add Mult O Opp -> forall x : S, A x -> Mult x O = O /\ Mult O x = O
absZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
succ_pred_pred_succZ : forall x : Z, succZ (predZ x) = predZ (succZ x)
eq_OZ_dec : forall x : Z, {x = OZ} + {x <> OZ}
EqdepFacts.internal_eq_rew_r_dep : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (P : forall y0 : A, y0 = y -> Type), P y eq_refl -> forall H : x = y, P x H
is_posn = fun x z : Z => match x with | pos n => match z with | pos m => n = m | _ => False end | _ => False end : Z -> Z -> Prop
sgnZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos _ => pos 0 | neg _ => neg 0 end : Z -> Z
simplification_integrity : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O I : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_unitary_commutative_ring S A Add Mult O I Opp -> integrity S Mult O -> forall a x : S, A a -> A x -> a <> O -> Mult a x = a -> x = I

```  
intros x H.
destruct H as [H1 H2].
destruct H1 as [H3 | H3].
- left. exact H3.
- right. exact H3.
```

original: intros x H. destruct H as [H1 H2]. destruct H1 as [H3 | H3]. - left. apply H3. - right. apply H3.
